text:
hey everyone welcome to the very first episode 
of Pai's kitchen and if you missed the memo and

you don't know about pies kitchen it's simply 
my second show where I share with you all things

delicious and yummy that are outside the scope of 
thai cuisine now hot thai kitchen is still coming

up on friday as per usual so in Canada we've 
just had our Thanksgiving not too long ago and

one of the classic traditional recipes to have for 
Thanksgiving is pumpkin pie now when I first came

to Canada I had pumpkin pie for the first time 
I didn't really love it so I wanted to see if I

can create a recipe that I would actually like and 
that's how this recipe came to be I've been making

it for years and I've never had anyone say they 
don't like it even the self-proclaimed pumpkin

pie hater so let's get started the first thing 
we're gonna make is the pie crust now you've got

a crust recipe that you always use by all means 
use that but I'm gonna show you one that is so

easy and it's a classic French crust called but 
breezy and it's not the flaky pie crust it's got

sort of a tart crust shortbread ii tenderness it's 
really good but most importantly you don't have to

worry about keeping things cold or overworking 
the dough it's really really simple all-purpose

flour a little bit of rice flour a little bit of 
salt get that mix that right on to a work surface

now this butter is actually softened and then 
I'm gonna rub it in with my fingers until it's

crumbly and there's no more big pieces I've got an 
egg yolk right here some water beat that together

into the center gradually stir everything into 
the middle gather all your dry stuff and kneading

it into the center so once it's sort of smooth 
a technique that the French called paisa smear

it across the counter and that's to get rid of 
any big lumps of butter chill in the fridge for

30 minutes and now roll it to about an eighth of 
an inch thick I'm gonna transfer that onto my pie

plate trim off the edges a really simple design 
you don't need to crimp it do anything crazy docks

the bottom of the pie I'm gonna let this rest 
in the fridge for 10 more minutes we're gonna

blind bacon what that means is we're gonna bake 
it with some pie weight on top in a 350 degree

oven 20 minutes so we want to take up the rice 
and let it bake for five more minutes to let

the bottom sort of dry up we're gonna make the 
candied pecans that are gonna go on top and this

will turn a plain pumpkin pie into something that 
actually looks really impressive dead simple I've

got some butter on here so once the butter 
is starting to melt and add some dark brown

sugar some maple syrup after all this is Canada 
and if you don't have maple syrup you can also

just use honey going with a little pinch of salt 
some roughly chopped pecans quick toss I'm gonna

turn the heat off just a thin coating I don't 
want these to be super sweet because of high is

already sweet spread them out onto a baking sheet 
and you want to do this while they're hot okay so

this goes into a 350 oven for seven minutes just 
to dry out the candy on the outside and then

that's it they're done okay all right let's make 
the filling now what's special about this pumpkin

pie is it's partially Sweden by white chocolate 
mmm you don't have to use chocolate chips you can

just use regular block of white chocolate but 
I just happen to have these so I've also got

some evaporated milk that's my Thai side coming 
through we always bake with evaporated milk I'm

gonna melt the chocolate in here I'm just gonna 
microwave this for 30 to 45 seconds just to get

it steaming kay not boiling over or anything just 
say so now it's hot I'm going to pour my white

chocolate into the evaporated milk I'm just gonna 
let it sit for a couple of minutes and the heat

the evaporated milk will get the white chocolate 
soft and melty we will deal with the pumpkin so

this is a pumpkin I'm using this is canned pumpkin 
in a can like this doesn't have to be this brand

and if you can't find canned pumpkin where you are 
or you've got lots of pumpkins leftover you can

steam the pumpkin and mash it okay so doesn't 
have to come from a can so I've got here some

cinnamon ginger and nutmeg the Nutmeg is optional 
it's really expensive for a spice if you don't

have it don't worry about it this is another 
secret of mine I'm going to add some orange

zest now if you don't like orange flavor you can 
also do lemon zest what you're trying to achieve

is some sort of a bright citrus flavor that helps 
lighten the heaviness of the pie a little bit and

that's actually one of the reasons why I didn't 
love pumpkin pie because it just felt so clean

and rich and so the citrus really helps lighten 
and brighten it up all right and then you get

to eat the rest of it I've got two egg yolks now 
the egg whites we're gonna keep we're gonna whip

up the egg whites and add it later so give this 
a quick stir the chocolate should have had time

to soften by now so I'm just going to give it a 
stir there you go and it's just gonna melt into

the evaporated milk is this like drinkable white 
chocolate into the pumpkin you just know at this

stage this is gonna be good give that a stir now 
I've also got one whole egg that I'm going to add

to this but before I add it I'm gonna use it as an 
egg wash on my pie crust my pie crust has come out

of the oven and I'm gonna use this egg to brush 
the edges and that'll just help the crust Brown

more beautifully at the end see one thing I like 
about using my own finger instead of a brush is

you don't lose any egg into the brush now we're 
gonna put this egg into the filling see now you

don't have a leftover egg from the egg wash so 
now that's mixed up this is the other really

good part so I'm going to stir in some white 
chocolate chips and so now when you bake up

this pie there's gonna be like little melty bits 
of white chocolate all through one of the things

I wanted to accomplish with this pious I wanted 
the filling to be really light and not so heavy

and so what I will do my two egg whites gonna whip 
this up into a meringue and fold it into the base

and give it that light texture so once it's foamy 
kind of like this I'm gonna start adding my brown

sugar and I'm using dark brown sugar makes it 
a little richer in flavor and you don't need it

to be stiff peaks or anything just soft peaks is 
fine that's fine you don't want the whole pumpkin

pie to be a giant puff ball in the oven it's just 
extra air extra lightness okay so I'm just gonna

fold this into my pumpkin mixture just half at a 
time so the first one you can do it quite quickly

to lighten the base the rest of it can go in now 
if you want to make this less sweet you don't

have to add the brown sugar at all if you you 
know watching your sugar and you still want to

deserve you don't like it overly sweet or you can 
omit the extra white chocolate chips it's quite a

forgiving recipe now it always looks like there's 
way more filling but it always just fits somehow

okay so now what I did that I didn't tell you was 
when the pie came out I turned the oven up to 375

and now this is gonna go in for 45 minutes there 
we go a couple of ways to know that this is done

first of all it's gonna be puffed up and you're 
gonna notice the edges starting to crack okay but

what you don't want is for the middle to also 
start cracking because that means that the pie

has overcooked so now we're going to finish this 
off by putting the candied pecans on it push them

in a little bit into the pie to secure them now 
is the hardest part you're gonna let this cool

for at least two hours right now it's too soft 
because one of the things that will help set

this pie is actually the white chocolate so if 
it's piping hot right now you won't be able to

get nice pieces out so let it cool until it's at 
least lukewarm it doesn't have to be completely

at room temp but at least lukewarm before you 
start digging in so plan ahead all right here's

the moment it's still kind of warm in the middle 
which is perfect again extremely useful tool the

little meanie offset spatula for pie who needs pie 
lifters pie lifters are awkward oh oh my god that

looks so good oh yeah look how soft and stuffy in 
custardy that looks I like a little bit of whipped

cream but not just any old whipped cream I made 
maple whipped cream it--and this gave maple syrup

when I'm in Canada so this is basically whipped 
cream that I just added some maple syrup into it

when I'm whipping and it's just as that nice fall 
autumn flavor that works really well with the pie

add a little extra of the candied pecans on top 
all right here we go see this is everything I

wish that first pumpkin pie I had was like it's 
light and fluffy yes it's still really moist and

creamy especially with that melty white chocolate 
bits inside and it's not heavy so with that citrus

flavor that we added it just sort of lightens 
everything up so you can really eat a lot of this

because you know how pumpkin pie sometimes two or 
three bites and just so full this isn't like that

especially with the crunch of the pecans there's 
lots of textural variety going on oh my god this

is so good so if you like to bake you got to give 
this a try if you've got Thanksgiving coming up

this will impress your guests I promise promise 
promise so the recipe for pies kitchen is still

gonna be on hot a kitchen calm so you don't have 
to go anywhere new for that and when you make it

please send me a photo I'd love to include 
them into my newsletter and you can send it

to me Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious then
